info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 10:12AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mecklenburg County in the piedmont of North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1008 AM EST, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches over part 12 hours in much of Mecklenburg County. Although the rain has ended, runoff from the recent heavy rainfall is causing streams and creeks to rise in the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northeast Charlotte, Harrisburg and University City. Flooding is most likely along Mallard Creek in low-lying areas near Pavilion Boulevard. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
